newsitem.title: INDIA: DELHI SHARES INCH HIGHER ON CAUTIOUS BUYING.
newsitem.headline: DELHI SHARES INCH HIGHER ON CAUTIOUS BUYING.

text.p: Delhi shares opened modestly higher on Friday as speculators and foreign funds made fresh purchases and selling slowed down, brokers said.

But major players, mainly foreign institutional investors (FIIs), were reluctant to enlarge their buying positions in view of reports the government was facing trouble in parliament from the opposition, they said.
After 30 minutes of trading, the benchmark index was 1.32 points higher at 944.62.

Prime Minister Inder Kumar Gujral's centre-left coalition withdrew a bill to set up an insurance regulator on Wednesday after failing to win enough strength on the floor of the parliament to beat back an amendment from Hindu nationalists.
"I feel a partial recovery seems to be temporary and stocks should drop in some counters as they they are still over-priced," said Bharat Bhushan Aggarwal of brokers Nu Era Equity.
TISCO rose marginally by 0.25 rupee to 217.50.
Hindustan Lever rose seven rupees to 1,550 on increased buying by foreign investors, brokers said.
Escorts Ltd rose three rupees to 116.
